descriptive_name: Distillates (petroleum), hydrotreated heavy naphthenic; Baseoil - unspecified

acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the information that its rabbit LD50 is > 5g/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the information that its rat LD50 is > 15g/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

aspiration_hazard.rationale: This substance is a hydrocarbon, but its kinematic viscosity is above 20.5 mm2/s at 40 degC (145 mm2/s at 40degC) (CONCAWE 1. product dossier no. 97/108 (1997)). Due to lack of other necessary information, classification is not possible.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it is rated as Group 1 by the IARC, the substance was classified into Category 1A. Additionally, it is documented that 80-week dermal administration tests using mice resulted in development of cancer in 31.0% (9 of 29 mice) to 81.0% (34 of 42 mice) of treated mice (IARC vol. 33 (1984)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: Due to dissociation of nitrogen and oxygen from hydrocarbon through the formation of ammonia and water, the saturation of unsaturated bonds and the deposition and separation of its metal components by the catalysts during the hydrorefining process, the substance does not contain chemical groups associated with explosive properties.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Its flash point is 249degC (IUCLID (2000)), which is above 110degC.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There are no in vivo study results available, as well as no positive reactions being reported in in vitro mutagenicity tests using several indices; thus, classification is not possible. With regard to in vitro mutagenicity tests, positive results were acquired in Ames tests and mouse lymphoma assays (IARC vol. 33 (1984), IUCLID (2000)).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Due to dissociation of oxygen from hydrocarbon through water formation during the hydrorefining process, the substance is considered as an organic compound containing no bivalent -O-O- structure.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Due to dissociation of oxygen from hydrocarbon through water formation, and the deposition and separation of its metal components by the catalysts during the hydrorefining process, the substance does not contain oxygen or halogen.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Due to dissociation of nitrogen and oxygen from hydrocarbon through the formation of ammonia and water, the saturation of unsaturated bonds and the deposition and separation of its metal components by the catalysts during the hydrorefining process, the substance does not contain chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since rabbit tests (OECD TG 405 GLP) (IUCLID (2000)) identified that the substance is slightly irritating, and the irritation disappeared within 7 days, it was classified into Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: As skin irritation tests using rabbits found that the substance is severe irritant (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was classified into Category 2.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Maximization tests using guinea pigs (OECD TG 406 GLP) found the substance not skin sensitizing (IUCLID (2000)), which indicated that the substance is to be placed in the "Not classified" category. However, the results were obtained using List 2 datasets, and there are no other study results available. As such, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Due to deposition and separation of its metal components by the catalysts during the hydrorefining process, the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In 28-day dermal administration tests using rabbits (IUCLID (2000)), it is documented that levels of SGOT and SGPT increased at the dose (1000 mg/kg/28 days, 90-day conversion value: 311 mg/kg) that is higher than Category 2 guidance values. However, since this is the only information available, classification is not possible due to lack of sufficient data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
